title: Dear Riot, now that you have literally halved the required XP for level 30
body:
Please, lower the MMR people have when they hit 30, new players are not at a silver level and this will cause a lot of problems... This was already one.


For those wanting more information:
http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-65-notes

replies.body: I think its fine, the average new player is better than a bronze player anyway.

youd be surprised, as much as i bitch and moan about being bronze 5, i do pull off some amazing plays from time to time that a new player wouldn't have the game knowledge to know to do.

For instance i started playing hec again recently and 90% of the game consists of me using flash or ulti right after my e to get me behind my opponent with a fully charged e knocking them into my team while simultaneously timing my q to be used as i land the auto so it benefits from my out of combat movement speed for insane burst damage.

A new player would be starting to figure out stuff like that but they wouldn't understand why it works (namely his e still charges up from movement abilities and his q doesnt interrupt his auto so you can time it so you auto and q in the same damage tick)

Granted im in bronze 5 due to attitude problems mainly (i lose once i play like shit for the rest of the day, i am 60% salt 25% tilt, 5% semi decent player) but thats beside the point, regardless of if i am an exception to the rule, or hell if im not even silver level and are more realistically high bronze or something, im still in a league that is lower than my skill level, and if one person exists, then many will exist down here.

Im not some special snowflake, im aware of many other summoners in bronze 5 that despite me making most b5 players look like shit on a good day, they make me look wood 5 on an average day, and they all have one common grain with me, tilt.

A great example is brown, amazing lee sin player, ive only seen him fuck up an insec once, but my god is he salty so he stays in b5 due to that.

If you have an attitude problem and tilt really hard like you say, an average new player probably IS better than you. Your skill level isn't determined by your best plays, its determined by how you play on average. Is some guy that goes 20-1 against you one game but then feeds for the next 10 games and loses every one better than you? probably not. In the same way, you could dominate for a few games, but if you tilt and lose the next 5, then you're not better than the people you're playing with.
Problem is most "New Players" are smurfs.

Still, some people know that they can abuse that fact and just make new accounts for the sake of its easier to rank up when they can't get out of bronze, I have a friend who couldn't get out of bronze and _bought_ new accounts until he got one into silver... Only took him 4 wins where he got carried on a fresh account...
Yeah and i bet it feels like less of an achievement for the guy knowing that is how he got it.
Nah he just bragged afterwards and was like finally baby...
